turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, can you recommend some music for me? I'm in the mood for something upbeat.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Sure! What genre are you thinking of? Knowing that will help me narrow things down.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, good question. I guess... pop-punk? But like, the good stuff, not the super mainstream stuff.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay! I would recommend checking out 'The Story So Far' or 'Neck Deep'. Do either of those sound appealing?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I know Neck Deep! They're okay. But The Story So Far... I've never heard of them. What makes them good? Why should I listen to them over, say, Blink-182?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: The Story So Far retains the energy and catchy hooks of classic pop-punk, but with more modern production and slightly more mature lyrical themes. Many find their music relatable and a fresh take on the genre. Give their album 'What You Don't See' a try; it's a good starting point.
